{
"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about pure left sided failure. Left-sided heart failure occurs when the left ventricle of the heart is unable to pump effectively. This can be caused by various conditions that affect the left side of the heart, such as ASD (Atrial Septal Defect), Aortic stenosis, Patent ductus arteriosus, or Pulmonary valvular obstruction.

The options provided are: a) ASD, b) Aortic stenosis, c) Patent ductus arteriosus, and d) Pulmonary valvular obstruction. Based on the information provided in the documents, it appears that a) ASD is a possible cause of pure left-sided failure.",
"answer_choice": "A"
